pr_title: Support DELETE statement with partition key for Cassandra

timeline.bodyText: There is no existing connector that makes DELETE statement configurable like this. Is this property mandatory in your environment?
timeline.author: ebyhr

replies.bodyText: No, I don't need it in my environment. I followed @Config("cassandra.allow-drop-table") and I just thought deleting data is more careful. But, I will remove it if no need.
replies.author: t2y

timeline.bodyText: I suppose the query should not be failed even if partition does not exist for the specified condition. Could you share your intention?
timeline.author: ebyhr

replies.bodyText: When a partition does not exist for the specified condition, we shouldn't execute a delete statement. At that time, should I return just OptionalLong.empty();? I'm not sure what handling is better for that condition.
replies.author: t2y
t2y

replies.bodyText:
I had forgotten that code prevents an error when there are no records with a given partition key.
Query 20200626_042205_00023_qzyzn failed: line 0:-1 no viable alternative at input '<EOF>'

I changed to return without any error in acceec1b.
replies.author: t2y

timeline.author: ebyhr

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                            "CREATE TABLE " + table + " (" + "partition_one bigint, " + "partition_two int, " + "clust_one text, " + "data text, " + "PRIMARY KEY((partition_one, partition_two), clust_one) " + ")");
          
          
            
                            "CREATE TABLE " + table + " ( " +
          
          
            
                                    "partition_one bigint, " +
          
          
            
                                    "partition_two int, " +
          
          
            
                                    "clust_one text, " +
          
          
            
                                    "data text, " +
          
          
            
                                    "PRIMARY KEY((partition_one, partition_two), clust_one))");

timeline.bodyText: If we can use Cassandra's QueryBuilder to build clause, it worth to use the library. But StringBuilder looks sufficient and then we can avoid this hack.

replies.bodyText: I see. I will construct CQL with StringBuilder only.

replies.bodyText:
Looking around other test code, the format is like this.
session.execute("CREATE TABLE " + table + " (" +
        ...
        "data text, " +
        "PRIMARY KEY((partition_one, partition_two), clust_one, clust_two, clust_three) " +
        ")");
replies.author: t2y

timeline.bodyText:
Please reorder the data.

timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -248,4 +250,62 @@ private static void insertTestData(CassandraSession session, SchemaTableName tab
         }
         assertEquals(session.execute("SELECT COUNT(*) FROM " + table).all().get(0).getLong(0), rowsCount);
     }
+
+    private static void createTableDeleteData(CassandraSession session, SchemaTableName table)
+    {
+        session.execute("DROP TABLE IF EXISTS " + table);
+        session.execute("CREATE TABLE " + table + " (" +
+                "partition_one bigint, " +
+                "partition_two int, " +
+                "clust_one text, " +
+                "data text, " +
+                "PRIMARY KEY((partition_one, partition_two), clust_one) " + ")");
+        insertIntoTableDeleteData(session, table);
+    }
+
+    private static void insertIntoTableDeleteData(CassandraSession session, SchemaTableName table)
+    {
+        /*   This function inserts data (15 records) as below.
+             partition_one | partition_two | clust_one   | data

+                         1 |             2 | clust_one_1 | null
+                         1 |             2 | clust_one_2 | null
+                         1 |             2 | clust_one_3 | null
+                         2 |             2 | clust_one_1 | null
+                         2 |             2 | clust_one_2 | null
+                         1 |             1 | clust_one_1 | null
+                         1 |             1 | clust_one_2 | null
+                         1 |             1 | clust_one_3 | null

+                         4 |             4 | clust_one_4 | null
+                         9 |             9 | clust_one_9 | null

+                         7 |             7 | clust_one_7 | null

timeline.bodyText:
Avoid abbreviation:
col1 → column1
col2 → column2
timeline.author: ebyhr
